content.description:
New route left of Rock Candy. If you have details (F.A. etc.), please advise and I'll amend this accordingly.

12 bolts, definitive 9+/10- crux passing 8th bolt, otherwise 5.8 and easier.
content.location: Starts below leaning pillar just right of I Yam â€“ two brown-painted bolt hangers to top of pillar, then follow the face and arete.

content.description: Climb the crack in the dihedral, right of "Bread Line".

Lots of fun easy/moderate moves in the usual Clark Canyon. Variation 2 makes the fun go on longer.

At the left end of this sector is a bit 20-foot-high rock with a 5-foot-wide platform below its right side.

Many people start by scrambling to the top of the big rock, where there is two-bolt anchor. Belaying from there reduces rope drag and makes communication much easier.

Then up the cool face past 7 bolts to anchor, and lower-off to platform below right from big rock.

Variation 1: The start in the print guidebook is to go up the awkward dihedral on right side of the big rock to reach the anchor on top - (5.8, 1 bolt).

Variation 2: Start instead far below the left side of the big rock, in a steep gully at the right end of the Left Side sector, next to the route "I Am". Up the gully at first steep (5.7, 1 bolt), then gentle to reach the anchor on top of big rock.

. . (Not sure how well-protected this is -- could also be done on top-rope).
Climb "Scorpio" or "Chop Chop", then follow a blunt arete to the left past 8 bolts.
Climb the steep, pocketed/featured face right of Cholito. Stemming to the left keeps the grade moderate at 10a. For more of a challenge, climb the face straight on at about 10d.
content.location: The steep face just right of the prominent dihedral of Cholito.

content.description: A stout boulder problem in the first two bolts of climbing leads to easier climbing on the right side of the face. At the top you are forced to leave the relative security of the arete to come back on to the face before the anchors.
content.location: Climbs the right side of the steep face to the right of a wide crack on the right side of the Area 13 Center zone. It's the next route right of No Left Turn.

climbs.name: Chop Chop
climbs.fa: Bill Trethewey, 1990s. Bolts added by Alan Hirahara.

content.description: This route follows the flake to the right of "Scorpio". It protects nicely with gear. I don't understand why the bolts were placed.
This starts in the left facing corner, right of "Chilango". Climb this corner, then face to an arete.
Climb the face on on some ok holds, move up and left to the crack at the second bolt. Enjoy some jamming if you like...
content.protection: 3 bolts to an anchor (2 open shuts)
content.location: in the middle of the face, to the right of chop chop. Start to the right of the crack and boulder.

content.description: Start on the face below the first bolt. Climb up passing the first bolt to gain the ledge and then on to the arete for the second bolt. Continue up the arete and then move up left to the large pocketed arete and follow this to the anchors.
